pre-page-demographics.title: Pre-learning survey - Demographics
pre-page-demographics.description: If you do not wish to answer a particular question, select "Prefer not to disclose" or enter "N/A".

questions.description: What is your gender?
What is your age?
What is your highest level of education?
Compared to the average person, how often do you think you use the Internet?
Compared to the average person, how often do you think you use text/chat interfaces (text messaging on a cell phone, iMessage, Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, etc.)?
How many online courses (Khan Academy, Coursera, Udacity, etc.) have you started?

choice.id: I have never started an online course
choice.description: I have never started an online course

questions.description:
What is your opinion of online courses? For example:
  • Do you like the way they teach?
  • How engaged and focused are you while working on online courses?
  • Have the courses you've taken adapted to your learning habits and performance?

If you were learning a new math concept, which of these 2 options would you prefer?

1. Read online lessons about the concept and learn the concept on your own
2. Have a tutor teach you the concept through text/picture messaging on your phone or in an online chat window

If you were learning a new math concept, which of these 2 options would you prefer?

1. Have a tutor teach you the concept through text/picture messaging on your phone or in an online chat window
2. Read online lessons about the concept and learn the concept on your own
What is the most advanced math class you have completed?
How old were you when you completed the math class selected in the previous question?

How familiar are you with arithmetic sequences and formulas?
  • 20, 50, 80, 110, ... is an example arithmetic sequence.
  • a(n) = 10 + 5(n - 1) is an example arithmetic sequence formula.

choice.description: I clearly understand arithmetic sequences and formulas.
I somewhat understand arithmetic sequences and formulas.
I have worked with arithmetic sequences and formulas in the past, but I don't remember how to use them.
I have not heard of arithmetic sequences or formulas.

questions.description: How would you rate your overall knowledge of arithmetic sequences and formulas?

pre-page-math-background-2.title: Pre-learning survey - Math background
pre-page-math-background-2.description: To help us determine your math background, please answer the following questions to the best of your ability.

questions.description:
6s - 4 = 8(2 + 0.25s)
What is the value of s?

-3x + 7y = 5x + 2y
If x = 5, what is the value of y?

Jessica watches 15 videos every day. Each video is 8 minutes long.
For how many days does Jessica need to watch videos to watch 9000 minutes of videos?

Harry owes the bank money. To repay the bank, he paid the bank $150 each month. After 10 months, he still owed the bank $6900.

How many more months will it take for Harry to finish paying back the bank?
What was the total amount that Harry originally owed the bank?

Describe how a video could be helpful or unhelpful for learning other math concepts. For example, consider these scenarios:

  • Tired / Fully alert
  • First time seeing the concept / Familiar with the concept

Please explain your answers to the questions on this page.

If you had 60 minutes to learn more about arithmetic sequences and then take a quiz for a large bonus payment, which of these 2 scenarios would you prefer?

1. Watch more videos about arithmetic sequences, then take the quiz.
2. Interact with an expanded version of the conversational computer program, then take the quiz.

If you had 60 minutes to learn more about arithmetic sequences and then take a quiz for a large bonus payment, which of these 2 scenarios would you prefer?

1. Interact with an expanded version of the conversational computer program, then take the quiz.
2. Watch more videos about arithmetic sequences, then take the quiz.

If you had 60 minutes to learn more about arithmetic sequences and then take a quiz for a large bonus payment, which of these 2 scenarios would you prefer?

1. Complete more interactive tutorials about arithmetic sequences, then take the quiz.
2. Interact with an expanded version of the conversational computer program, then take the quiz.
